artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsujiokaya Bunsuke; Carver: Koizumi Kanegorō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 194; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 51 p. 297.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; battle scene; pink and grey lines of cannon and rifle fire horizontally across picture plane; man on a bucking brown horse at center, with a long staff; man with rectangular shield on a white horse at left; clouds of grey, pink and blue smoke at top and center; group of men wearing black helmets and purple blouses at top center, shooting rifles; another group of men wearing purple at top right, either fallen or lying on ground; two men in foreground, LRC--one seen from behind and another reaching up; two fallen men in LLC; this triptych is left side of a continuous image with six sheets, along with 2017.106.74a-c
dimension: 14 1/2 × 9 3/4 in. (36.83 × 24.77 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Carver’s seal R: 彫工兼五郎 {horikō Kanegorō} | C, L: 彫兼 {hori Kane} | Censor seal: 卯六改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: Picture of the Bloody Battle of the Brave Generals of the Takeda Clan
